result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

Defendant Keosha M Turner in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for Final Pretrial.

Defendant Keosha M Turner in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. State placed offer on the record and the Defendant rejected the offer.
Defendant requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keosha M Turner in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Pretrial Conference. 
Defendant appears Pro se and  is not eligible for public defender appointment and request to represent herself. 
Defendant advised of her  right to counsel.  Court examined defendant as to her request to represent herself.
Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his/her  right to counsel.  
State to turn over discovery and an offer to the defendant. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KLT.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Keosha M Turner in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Keosha M Turner not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/11/22 @ 2p
